result.execSummary:
The defendant Kerry A Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time
IF REVOKED 1 day sentence credit

miscConds.notes:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia

No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

No contact with the Jeremy House

Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kerry A Olson

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Letter from Atty Herbers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

10:02 AM Defendant Kerry A Olson in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Kerry A Olson. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigal Kincheloe. 

Defendant enters a no-contest plea to count #1. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds them guilty of count #1. Count #2 is dismissed and read-in. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant does not make statements. 

Court orders the following:	

Count #1: 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
60 Days Jail, Straight Time. (Credit - 1 day).  

Term of Probation: 12 months

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
No contact with:  The Jeremy House
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

1:34 PM Defendant Kerry A Olson in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Kerry A Olson.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Herbers requests another plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   
Defendant Kerry A Olson did not appear.    
Attorney appeared by authorization.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:25 AM Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Kerry A Olson did not appear.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Herbers appears by authorization, and advises he has not received an offer yet. Another date set. 

  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Hearing on May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
*Notice was not mailed as defendant does not have a permanent address.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with the Jeremy House listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

02:14 PM Defendant Kerry A Olson in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
